name: UnityBuildTask
description: Build a Unity project and get the exported output files.
helpMarkDown: Builds a Unity project to supported build target platforms. [More Information](https://github.com/Dinomite-Studios/unity-azure-pipelines-tasks)
author: Dinomite Studios

inputs.name: buildTarget
inputs.label: Build Target
inputs.helpMarkDown: Build platform to build the Unity project for.

inputs.name: unityEditorsPathMode
inputs.label: Unity Editors Location
inputs.helpMarkDown: Define where to look for Unity installations on the agent.

options.environmentVariable: Use UNITYHUB_EDITORS_FOLDER_LOCATION environment variable on agent

inputs.name: customUnityEditorsPath
inputs.label: Editors Folder Location
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify where to look for Unity Editor versions on the agent.

inputs.name: unityProjectPath
inputs.label: Unity Project Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: (Optional) Enter the directory path to the Unity project. If no value is entered, the root of the repository will be used.

inputs.name: commandLineArgumentsMode
inputs.label: Command Line Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Use the task's default set of command line arguments or specify custom arguments.

inputs.name: developmentBuild
inputs.label: Development Build
inputs.helpMarkDown: (Optional) Build a development version of the player.

inputs.name: acceptApiUpdate
inputs.label: Run API Updater
inputs.helpMarkDown: (Optional) Use this option to specify that Unity API Updater should run before building the project.

inputs.name: noGraphics
inputs.label: No Graphics Device
inputs.helpMarkDown: (Optional) Do not initialize the graphics device at all. This makes it possible to run your automated workflows on machines that don’t even have a GPU (automated workflows only work when you have a window in focus, otherwise you can’t send simulated input commands). Note that -nographics does not allow you to bake GI, because Enlighten requires GPU acceleration.

inputs.name: buildScenes
inputs.label: Build Scenes
inputs.helpMarkDown: (Optional) Enter a comma separated list of scene paths to include in the build. If no value is entered, the project's pre-configured scenes will be included.

inputs.name: customCommandLineArguments
inputs.label: Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify your custom command line arguments, see the [documentation](https://docs.unity3d.com/Manual/CommandLineArguments.html) for more info.

inputs.name: outputFileName
inputs.label: Output Filename
inputs.helpMarkDown: (Optional) Enter the output filename to be used when constructing the platform-appropriate output.  For instance, if you want the output to be 'thegame.exe' on Windows Standalone, enter 'thegame'

inputs.name: specifyLogFile
inputs.label: Specify Log File
inputs.helpMarkDown: (Optional) Enables settings to specify a logfile name. The logfile can then be used to find build errors. You can find the logfile after the build in the build output directory. Use the `buildOutputPath` output variable to find it.

inputs.name: logFileName
inputs.label: Logfile Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter the output filename to be used when constructing the platform-appropriate output.  For instance, if you want the output to be 'thegame.exe' on Windows Standalone, enter 'thegame'

OutputVariables.name: buildOutputPath
OutputVariables.description: Path to the directory containing Unity build output files. Path is relative to repository root.

OutputVariables.name: editorLogFilePath
OutputVariables.description: Path to the Unity editor log file. Path is relative to repository root. Only set, if `Specify Log File` enabled.
